other man for launching the Ed
vocational program was elected as
the first Commissioner of Edu-
cation at the Grand Lodge in 1925,
during which time the first reso-,
luton establishing the Depart
ment of Education was intro
duced.


The first Health Survey was
planned in 1927, in New ork City.
This survey pertained to the
population, sanitation. housing
and hospital facilities, among
Negroes. Chairman of this Com
mittee was Br. William ].
Thompkins.


The institution Of a permanent
Commission on Civil Liberties
was recommended at Grand
Lodge In 1927 by the Exalted
Ruler ]. Finley Wilson. SAID
commission to work Increasingly
for complete rights under law,
for the Negro Americans 90
citizens, and thus the fight was
begun against discrimination,
Jim Crow laws and lynching.


The Elks have Joined forces and
have made the greatest financial
contributions of any other or
ganization in support of the
NAACP, in the fight for Civil
Liberties.


Many of the freedoms of
democracy totally unknown to the
Negroes. heretofore, have now,
through the assistance and
demands of Civil Liberties Dept,
provided better living conditions
through equalized employment.


1860 statistics 40 students
in Universities of America.


Students of the Little Rock
incident received scholarships.
Fifty-three (53) holarships will
be the goal setfor this year (le6l)
with 100000 allowed for the
Project. $40,oo0.000 was spent
in 1859 on school integration.

American Elkdom origin
all began with a small group
of actors who gathered weekly
partnership and social pleasure
in New York in 1867.


One of the games they played
was Cork, and the group was
then known as the Jolly Corkers.
AS the groups grew larger, they
decided to organize as a Lodge,
or Fraternal Order: and initia-
ton consisted of playing Cork
with pranks added to the fun.


The name Elks was chosen for
the emblem of the elk. 1t was
noted that the great antlers of
the elk were ever spread to pro-
tect its own. The elk was the
fleetest Of foot, of the animal
kingdom and only fought to pro-
tect the female, the weak and
the young.


The formal change Of name
to the Benevolent and Protecdver
Order Of Elks took place In Fe.'
Is, 1856


work was added. In 1871 the
Grand Lodge was organized as
Parent Body to subordinate
Lodges, this being composed of
the original founders, present
and past officers.


There was great antagonism
between the whites and Negroes
over use of copies of the orr
ginal rituals. The first charter
for incorporation Of Negro Elks
was issued in Ohio, in 1899 and
the first Grand Lodge of Negro
Elks was held June 10, 1899
in Cincinnati through the
efforts of Arthur ]. Riggs and
BIZ. Howard of Kentucky.


The first Temple of Daughters.
was organized by Emma V. Kelley
in 1902.


Judge William c. Hueston. who
was more responsible than any

The Arizona Tribune has naugurated worthwhile projects
during the six of continuous publication We
have the beginning the young
carriers who able school entertainment funds


Many carriers have saved their paper money


trips shoes books and swimming fees but ali have developed SELL
ing ability and self reliance.


Over the several young carriers have received watches
and incentive prizes These young winners
morroWs business leaders.


Our scholarship has provided books and supplies for
than dozen elementary school graduates This IL
keeping youth school, We hope will UNDER
take similar projects.


Weekly within found articles Negro history and
achievement. feel that pride impaired only


newspapers and magazines maintain positive approach
and minimize the false bizarre and CORY details.


BY praising Teen of the Week. the Tribune publishers wife
and believe that Juveniles will feel inspired read about them
selves and their young friends who the delinquent rolls


Looking backward am glad know that newspaper was
ponsbe setting forth the first statewide
Negro History Week. This and other memories make
view the future knowing that there much be done

Views, PRevIEws
AMO REVIEWS


Edward Banks

1o0I 4~cy W*S A1Ay ~~~ A~J'
l hardly had time to celebrate 1t
in my usual manner with a festive
gathering of friends. This day
rolled upon me SO quickly as Twas
caught in the middle of web Of
circumstance.


My spouse had returned a week
earlier from the National Repub-
lican Party convention In San
Francisco. He has been robbed
while there and few hours after
his arrival had to rush him to
the hospital.


He remained In the hospital for
four days and 1t was business as
usual for me plus daily visits to
Good Samaritan Hospital.


Whenever he has been hospita-
lied always spend as much time
as possible there for no number Of
nurses or aides can ever replace
a wife or close friend.


My Mother arrived Monday
morning and she was shocked to
discover her son-in-law s plight.
He recovered enough to come
home Tuesday and Immediately
1t was time to get the next issue
of the paper ready.


The days went too quickly and
on Friday. my natal day. | was
busy with paper work. Finally
about four | returned home and
was surprised to find delicious
dinner prepared and huge birth
day cake. My Mother had pre-
pared one of the most beautiful
cakes have ever seen. Its taste
matched its looks. We ate and
ate and my mouth seemingly re-
fused to open for another piece
of cake.


For the first time in many
years did not have birthday
party, but l had the best gifts in
the world. My husband was on
the road to recovery and my dear
Mother Hattie was with us.


Edward told me he was sorry
that he had been unable to get out
and buy me a gift. but he smiled
when l told him that his release
from the hospital had been one Of
the best presents.


My Mothers birthday Is July
81, perhaps we will not forget to
sing "Happy Birthday. You
know | was so busy that last
Friday we forgot to sing the
traditional tune.


Guess I must be really getting
old. Gosh.

The local chapter Of the Congress Of
Racial Equality tested the Yecently passed
city ordinance foYbidding dis elimination
in places Of public accommodations, en-
cludi'zg barber and beauty shops. The
chapter sbokesnaen reported faUOYubly
except in one place.


Charges WeYe filed Wednesday against
the Owners and operators of the Ell Rey
Cafe, 922 S. Central AUe.o This restaurant
operated by Mexican Anne p1cans is located
I'm a yuciolly mixed community where
many Negroes and Mexicans hUe side by
side and attend schools together. Last
year the Ell Rey Cafe mas the site of the
first sitins which occurred in the city.


Mrs. PeYula Yetutes charges that
CORE members placed against her. she
said that she treats everyone fairly and
that they GORE or NegYoes) are just
trying to cause her trouble.


CORE testers said tho we're refused
service and the prices weYe changed When
four others WeYe served.


The Ell Rey Cafe case uIll be the first
heard by the civil rights board set up under
the Phoenix Human Re lations Commission.


Mrs. Peyulta should remember that
there are many groups Of minority ber-
sons IN our Guy UVd WttOW. 1NeVe Gun w
nothing gained If minority groups practice
dis examination against each other. The
same civil rights LAWS which by1ote ct the
Negro, also byote cts the Indian, the Chinese,
the Mexican, the JeO and any other group,
regardless of race, creed, color or place
ofnotional origin.


Discussing Arizona Law
Kidnapping


of crimes Thus
kidnapping" to 10 prison;
aggravated Kidnapping 20 to oyears prison. and
aggravated kidnapping bodily harm bydeah or by prison for
chance for parole


Kidnapping taking hdeaway for ransom;
movement not the distance moved is the defining idea
In kidnapping. also includes threats of force


What aggravated" kidnapping with bodily harm7 various
cases. ries decide the penalties found aggravated
kidnapping burned the victims hands, struck
him. overeated closet for an hour we'll
moved him.


found kidnapping the criminal merely moved the
home. another case he moved the
only feet from parked to his car.

Sights and Sounds
ELotse BANKS

No Party
full articles.article:
1o0I 4~cy W*S A1Ay ~~~ A~J'
l hardly had time to celebrate 1t
in my usual manner with a festive
gathering of friends. This day
rolled upon me SO quickly as Twas
caught in the middle of web Of
circumstance.


My spouse had returned a week
earlier from the National Repub-
lican Party convention In San
Francisco. He has been robbed
while there and few hours after
his arrival had to rush him to
the hospital.


He remained In the hospital for

Whenever he has been hospita-
lied always spend as much time

nurses or aides can ever replace

He recovered enough to come

on Friday. my natal day. | was
busy with paper work. Finally
about four | returned home and
was surprised to find delicious
dinner prepared and huge birth
day cake. My Mother had pre-
pared one of the most beautiful
cakes have ever seen. Its taste
matched its looks. We ate and
ate and my mouth seemingly re-
fused to open for another piece
of cake.

years did not have birthday
party, but l had the best gifts in

sing "Happy Birthday. You
know | was so busy that last
Friday we forgot to sing the
traditional tune.


Guess I must be really getting
old. Gosh.
